title: S.A. theater stars take a bow - San Antonio Express-News

Photo: Courtesy Tracey Maurer Image 28 of 28 S.A. theater stars take a bow 1 / 28 Back to Gallery The Alamo Theatre Arts Council ’s Globe Awards, which honor achievement on San Antonio’s stages, will be given out Sunday at the Charline McCombs Empire Theatre . Awards will be given for acting, directing, design and overall production of comedies, musicals and dramas.
For the first time, college productions have been broken out and will be recognized on their own rather than being mixed in with the other shows.
A total of 35 shows will be recognized. In addition, Rick and Diane Malone will be given the Jasmina Wellinghoff Award for contributions to the city’s theater scene. And Globe-goers will get to vote on a People’s Choice winner that will be announced that night.
More Information Alamo Theatre Arts Council Globe Awards
What: The Globe Awards will recognize 35 productions by San Antonio theaters and colleges. In addition, the audience will get to vote on a People’s Choice award.
Where: Charline McCombs Empire Theatre, 226 N. St. Mary’s St.
When: Bar opens and light hors d’oeuvres served at 6 p.m.; pre-show music at 6:30, ceremony at 7 p.m. today.
Tickets: $20-$35 Majestic Theatre box office; tickets purchased through ticketmaster.com include service fees.
Information: atac-sa.org.
The evening gets underway at 6 p.m. with drinks, followed by pre-show music at 6:30 and the awards at 7. Tickets range from $20 to $35 at the Majestic Theatre box office or at ticketmaster.com; Ticketmaster tacks on additional service fees.
Click through the slideshow for a preview of many of the productions that will be honored.
